Key Match Events: South Africa won by 5 wickets (with 2 balls remaining)
Pre-Game Insights: India are favourites on paper and recent form
South Africa need to make up for lost points to stay in contention
Virat Kohli is on the verge of a T20 World Cup record
Rilee Rossouw is looking to score successive T20I centuries
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch in Perth is expected to be pacy with pace, bounce, and early swing
The average first innings score is 143, and 200 has only been breached once at this venue
Rain is unlikely to affect the match
Others: India and South Africa have met five times in T20 World Cups, but not since 2014
South Africa were the last team to beat India, in a dead rubber in their three-match series earlier this month
